questions.question: Give my love to Mira in case you ............................ her.
questions.description: We normally use a simple present to refer to future in subordinate clauses.

questions.question: The first time I ................................... him was last week.
questions.description: The present perfect is not used with past time expressions.

questions.question: This is the house .................................... I was born in.
questions.description: This is the house where I was born is also correct.

questions.question: I .................................... a strange experience yesterday.
questions.description: The simple present or present perfect cannot be used with past time expressions.

questions.question: They ................................... married last month.
questions.description: To simply say that something happened sometime ago, we use the simple past.

questions.question: .................................... the rain, they went out.
questions.description: Either despite or in spite of is possible here.

questions.question: ............................... it was cold outside, she insisted on going.
questions.description: Even if refers to future. However is not a conjunction.

questions.question: She has got ..................................... hair.
questions.description: Hair is uncountable in English. It cannot be used with a/an.

questions.question: .................................... she is late, we will leave without her.
questions.description: In case is a conjunction it is followed by a clause.

questions.question: You cooked ................................... more food than necessary.
